meanings.explanation: [MEANING 1]n放纵: carefree, freedom from constraint
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]added spices to the stew with complete abandon 肆无忌惮地向炖菜里面加调料

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 2]v 放纵: to give (oneself) over unrestrainedly
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]abandon oneself to emotion 感情用事，abandon herself to a life of complete idleness 放纵自己过着闲散的生活

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 3]v 放弃: to withdraw from often in the face of danger or encroachment
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]abandon the ship/homes 弃船，离家

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 4]v停止做某事: to put an end to (something planned or previously agreed to)
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]the bad weather forced NASA to abandon the launch 坏天气迫使 NASA 停止了发射

desc:
[MEANING 1]n.放纵: carefree, freedom from constraint
[EXAMPLE]added spices to the stew with complete abandon 肆无忌惮地向炖菜里面加调料
[SYNONYMS]unconstraint, uninhibitedness, unrestraint
[MEANING 2]v. 放纵: to give (oneself) over unrestrainedly
[EXAMPLE]abandon oneself to emotion 感情用事，abandon herself to a life of complete idleness 放纵自己过着闲散的生活
[SYNONYMS]indulge, surrender, give up
[MEANING 3]v. 放弃: to withdraw from often in the face of danger or encroachment
[EXAMPLE]abandon the ship/homes 弃船，离家
[ANTONYM]salvage 救援
[MEANING 4]v.停止做某事: to put an end to (something planned or previously agreed to)
[EXAMPLE]the bad weather forced NASA to abandon the launch 坏天气迫使 NASA 停止了发射
[SYNONYMS]abort, drop, repeal, rescind, revoke, call off
[ANTONYM]keep, continue, maintain, carry on 继续

derv.explanation: [[DERIVATIVES]]animation 生命力，活力: the quality or condition of being alive, active, spirited, or vigorous

desc:
[MEANING 1]adj.活的: having or showing life
[EXAMPLE]The lecture was about ancient worship of animate and inanimate objects演讲是关于对生命体和非生命体的古代崇拜。
[SYNONYMS]breathing, live, living
[ANTONYM]dead, expired, deceased, lifeless, nonliving 无生命的
[MEANING 2]adj.有活力的: having much high-spirited energy and movement
[EXAMPLE]Animate dance will get the blood pumping 有活力的舞蹈会让人热血沸腾。
[SYNONYMS]bouncing, brisk, energetic, sprightly, vivacious
[ANTONYM]inactive, lackadaisical, languid, listless, leaden 没有活力的，无精打采的
[MEANING 3]v.使有活力，支持: to give spirit and support to
[EXAMPLE]The writer's humor animates the novel 作者的幽默使小说富有生命力。
[SYNONYMS]brace, energize, enliven, invigorate, ginger (up), pep up, vitalize 使有活力
[ANTONYM]damp, dampen, deaden 使没活力
[[DERIVATIVES]]animation 生命力，活力: the quality or condition of being alive, active, spirited, or vigorous
[ANTONYM]lassitude, lethargy疲倦,疲乏
[MEANING 4]v.使行动，驱使: to move to action
[EXAMPLE]a criminal animated by greed 一个受贪婪驱使的罪犯
[SYNONYMS]goad, prod, spur, galvanize, stimulate
[MEANING 5]v.使活灵活现，使栩栩如生: to make or design in such a way as to create apparently spontaneous lifelike movement
[EXAMPLE]Kongfu Panda's very realistic panda was animated by CG《功夫熊猫》电影里面的熊猫是通过CG技术使熊猫变得活灵活现的。

desc:

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 2]vi处理掉(与 of 连用，dispose of): to get rid of; throw out
[MEANING 3]v布置有序: to place, distribute, or arrange especially in an orderly way
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]Dispose the surgical instruments in the exact order in which they would be needed 把手术仪器按他们被需要的顺序放置。

derv.example: [EXAMPLE]not feel disposed to argue with her 不喜欢与她争执

derv.explanation: [[DERIVATIVES]]disposal n处理，不再利用: the act of getting rid of something that is no longer wanted or needed
derv.example: [EXAMPLE]the permanent disposal of radioactive wastes对放射性废物的永久处理

desc:
[MEANING 1]vt.使倾向: to give a tendency to: incline
[EXAMPLE]faulty diet disposes one to sickness 营养不全面导致疾病
[[DERIVATIVES]]disposed adj喜欢的: willing or likely，inclined
[EXAMPLE]n.ot feel disposed to argue with her 不喜欢与她争执
[SYNONYMS]willing, inclined, predisposed, prone
[ANTONYM]disinclined, indisposed 不喜欢的
[MEANING 2]vi.处理掉(与 of 连用，dispose of): to get rid of; throw out
[[DERIVATIVES]]disposal n处理，不再利用: the act of getting rid of something that is no longer wanted or needed
[EXAMPLE]the permanent disposal of radioactive wastes对放射性废物的永久处理
[MEANING 3]v.布置有序: to place, distribute, or arrange especially in an orderly way
[EXAMPLE]Dispose the surgical instruments in the exact order in which they would be needed 把手术仪器按他们被需要的顺序放置。
[SYNONYMS]array, arrange
[ANTONYM]disarrange, disarray, disorder, upset, mess up, muss up 使混舌

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 1]vt漠视，不关注: to pay no attention to
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]disregard the advice of his executives 漠视执行管理者的建议

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 2]n缺乏兴趣，缺乏关心: lack of interest or concern
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]Revelers fired guns in the air with complete disregard for the possible consequences饮酒狂欢者一点 也不关心后果的开枪。

desc:

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 1]vt仔细分析: to examine, analyze, or criticize in minute detail
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]dissect some basic problems in mathematics analysis 仔细分析一些数学分析的基本问题 ； let's dissect the plot of this thriller to see what makes it thrilling 让我们来仔细分析一下这个恐怖电影为什么恐怖。

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 2]v做滑稽的模仿(以取笑): to copy or exaggerate (someone or something) in order to make fun of
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]The comedian was famous for mimicking the President's distinctive lisp这个演员因能滑稽地模仿总统特有的口齿不清而闻名

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 3]v模仿: to use (someone or something) as the model for one's speech, mannerisms, or behavior
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]began to learn their language by mimicking the sounds they made 通过模仿发音来学习语言

desc:
[MEANING 1]adj.仿真的，仿造的: being such in appearance only and made with or manufactured from usually cheaper materia
[EXAMPLE]Police were concerned that the mimic gun, although intended only as a toy, might be confused with the real thing in certain situations.尽管仿真枪只是玩具，但警方担忧在某些情况下它会被误认为是真枪
[SYNONYMS]artificial, bogus, factitious, fake, false, imitative, mock, sham, simulated, substitute, synthetic
[ANTONYM]genuine, natural, real 真实的
[MEANING 2]v.做滑稽的模仿(以取笑): to copy or exaggerate (someone or something) in order to make fun of
[EXAMPLE]The comedian was famous for mimicking the President's distinctive lisp.这个演员因能滑稽地模仿总统特有的口齿不清而闻名
[SYNONYMS]burlesque, caricature, do, imitate, mock, parody, send up, spoof, travesty
[MEANING 3]v.模仿: to use (someone or something) as the model for one's speech, mannerisms, or behavior
[EXAMPLE]began to learn their language by mimicking the sounds they made 通过模仿发音来学习语言
[SYNONYMS]ape, copy, copycat, emulate, mimic, simulate
[[DERIVATIVES]]mimicry n. 模仿

desc:
[MEANING 1]vt.撤销，废除(法律等): to rescind or annul by authoritative act
[EXAMPLE]The company called the furniture store to repeal the order for six new desks.公司要求家具店撤销六张 新桌子的订单。 In 1933, Congress passed the 21st Amendment which repealed the Prohibition Amendment of 1919, thus making the sale, distribution, and use of alcohol legal once again. 1933 年，国会通过了《第二十一修正案》，该法案废除了于1919年制订的《禁酒法》，从而使得酒的买卖、配送和使用再次合法化。
[SYNONYMS]abort, abrogate, annul, cancel, disannul, invalidate, negate, null, nullify, rescind, revoke, vacate, void
[ANTONYM]continue, keep 继续执行；enact, establish, legislate 立法，制订
[MEANING 2]vt.宣布与...决裂: to refuse to follow, obey, or recognize any further
[EXAMPLE]If I find that you have been lying about this, I'll instantly repeal every promise I made to you.只要我发现在这个问题上你对我撒了谎，那我们之间的承诺就彻底断裂了。
[SYNONYMS]forswear, recant, renege, renounce, repudiate, retract, withdraw
[ANTONYM]adhere, stick坚持，忠于

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 1]vt抵制: to fight against; resist
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]Self-discipline ensures that you can repel the things that induce you自律可以保证你抵制那些诱惑你的 事物。 I repelled the temptation to stay out late and call in sick the next day 我抵住了 晚上玩通宵然后第二天谎称生病的诱惑。

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 2]vt使厌恶: to cause aversion in: disgust
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]Evil odors always repel me臭味总、是让我恶心、。

desc:
[MEANING 1]vt.抵制: to fight against; resist
[EXAMPLE]Self-discipline ensures that you can repel the things that induce you.自律可以保证你抵制那些诱惑你的 事物。 I repelled the temptation to stay out late and call in sick the next day. 我抵住了 晚上玩通宵然后第二天谎称生病的诱惑。
[SYNONYMS]buck, defy, fight, oppose, resist, withstand
[ANTONYM]capitulate, submit, succumb, surrender, yield, give in 屈服
[MEANING 2]vt.使厌恶: to cause aversion in: disgust
[EXAMPLE]Evil odors always repel me.臭味总、是让我恶心、。
[SYNONYMS]disgust, nauseate, repulse, revolt, sicken
[ANTONYM]allure, attract, bewitch, captivate, charm, enchant, entice, fascinate, lure, seduce, tempt 吸引，诱惑
[[DERIVATIVES]]repelling adj. 令人厌恶的

meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]The chef's repertoire of specialties seems to be limited, with several of the dishes appearing over and over again in slightly varied guises这个厨师的所有拿手好戏看来是很有限的，因为上来的几盘菜看起来只是稍微换了 一下装饰而己。

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 1]n(劳作后的)休息: a state of resting after exertion or strain
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]The doctor ordered a period of repose for the patient suffering from insomnia医生要求正在饱受失眠折 磨的病人好好休息一阵。

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 2]n平静，宁静: a state of freedom from storm or disturbance
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]We enjoyed the repose of a summer evening on a remote island 我们在遥远的小岛上共享了夏曰傍晚的片刻安宁。

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 3]vi休息: to take a rest
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]They have to repose on couches because all beds have been occupied因为所有的床都有人占了，他们 不得不在沙发上休息。

meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]The Constitution reposes the power to declare war to Congress, and to that body alone 宪法将宣战的权力交给了国会单独保管。

desc:

[SYNONYMS]calmness, hush, peace, placidity, quietness, restfulness, serenity, still, tranquility

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 1]vt镇压: to put down by force, usually before total control has been lost; quell

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 1]n堕落者，道德败坏的人: a morally unprincipled person
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]The program rehabilitates reprobates and turns them into hard-working, law-abiding citizens 这个项目让那些堕落的人改过自新，并将他们变成勤劳守法的好公民。

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 2]adj堕落的，放荡的: morally corrupt
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]He is a reprobate judge who could be bribed, and often with astonishing ease他是一个堕落的法官，极其容易就被贿赂了。

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 3]vt谴责，痛斥: to condemn strongly as unworthy, unacceptable, or evil
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]He reprobated his son's unconventional lifestyle 他怒斥他儿子不遵循传统的生活习惯。

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 4]vt拒绝，不提供: to be unwilling to grant
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]The government will most likely reprobate the request for parole 政府很有可能会拒绝假释的要求。

desc:
[MEANING 1]n.堕落者，道德败坏的人: a morally unprincipled person

[SYNONYMS]debased, debauched, degraded, depraved, dissipated, dissolute, libertine, perverse, perverted, rakish

[MEANING 3]vt.谴责，痛斥: to condemn strongly as unworthy, unacceptable, or evil

[SYNONYMS]blame, criticize, censure, condemn, denounce, denunciate, reprehend
[ANTONYM]commend, eulogize, extol, laud, praise 表扬
[MEANING 4]vt.拒绝，不提供: to be unwilling to grant

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 1]n猛击: a forceful blow
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]He has not been the same ever since he received that bash on his head自从他脑袋被别人打了之后，他就变得大不一样。

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 2]vt攻击，用力击打: to strike violently and often repeatedly
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]The angry child kept bashing her toy with a hammer until it broke 愤怒的小孩用锤子不断地敲击她的玩具，直到它彻底被破坏。

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 3]vt抨击，严厉批评: to criticize harshly and usually publicly
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]In all of talk radio no other host seems to enjoy bashing liberals as much as he does在电台节目再没有像他一样热衷于抨击自由主义者的主持人了。

[MEANING 2]vt.使...崇高，使...神圣: to assign a high status or value to
[EXAMPLE]Some movie buffs canonized David Fincher as today's most preeminent director. 一些影迷把大卫•芬奇视作是当今世界上最为出色的导演。

[ANTONYM]abase, degrade, demean, humble, humiliate 贬低，瞧不起

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 2]adj无疑问的，无保留的: being without doubt or reserve
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]Members of the expedition must have implicit trust in their leaders远征的队员必须百分之百地信任他们的领队。

desc:
[MEANING 1]adj.不言而喻的，心照不宣的: capable of being understood from something else though unexpressed
[EXAMPLE]The implicit agreement among members of the outing club is that everyone pays his or her own way on all trips. 野外俱乐部成员之间一条心照不宣的约定就是: 沿途所有开销都AA。
[SYNONYMS]implied, unexpressed, unspoken, unvoiced, wordless
[ANTONYM]explicit, expressed, spoken, stated, voiced 明确声明的
[MEANING 2]adj.无疑问的，无保留的: being without doubt or reserve
[EXAMPLE]Members of the expedition must have implicit trust in their leaders.远征的队员必须百分之百地信任他们的领队。
[SYNONYMS]assured, clear, confident, doubtless, positive, sanguine, sure
[ANTONYM]doubtful, dubious, uncertain, unsure不确定的，存有疑惑的

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 1]n冒名顶替者，骗子: one that assumes false identitv or title for the purpose of deception
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]The man who claimed to be my townsman turned out to be an impostor那个自称是我老乡的人结果是个骗子。

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 1]n刺激，诱因: something that incites or has a tendency to incite to determination or action
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]The handsome reward for the missing wallet was an incentive for me to start looking找到丢失钱包的 可观报酬激励我展开搜寻。 A little bonus will give employees an incentive to work harder 一点点奖金就可以剌激雇员更加努力地工作。

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 1]adj义不容辞的，必须的: imposed as an obligation or duty
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]It is incumbent upon individuals to sacrifice for their country when it is in danger 当国家受难时，个人应 该义不容辞地为国做出牺牲。 It is incumbent upon the press to act not in its own best interests, but in society's best interests 对于媒体来说，为社会的利益(而非自身利益)服务是其应尽的义务。

meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]The tired puppy was lagging behind the rest of the pack 疲倦的小狗在队伍的后面缓缓地走着。

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 1]n许可，认可: the approval by someone in authority for the doing of something
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]The company is seeking license to operate several more power plants in the state公司正在寻求在国内 建造更多电厂的许可。 A restaurant owner has to get a license to serve food and drink餐厅营业者必须要获得食物和饮品的销售许可。

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 2]n自由: the right to act or move freely
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]Military commanders on the ground must be granted considerable license, as wars cannot be micromanaged by people back in Washington 战地指挥官应该被赋予相当大的自由，因为一场战争只靠华盛顿 的人是不可能打赢的。

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 3]n放荡: disregard for standards of personal conduct

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 4]vt准许，授权使用: to permit or authorize especially by formal license
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]A state statute licenses county sheriffs to choose their own deputies法律允许郡上的司法长官选择自己的副手。 licensed to use deadly force获准使用致命火力

desc:

[EXAMPLE]The company is seeking license to operate several more power plants in the state.公司正在寻求在国内 建造更多电厂的许可。 A restaurant owner has to get a license to serve food and drink.餐厅营业者必须要获得食物和饮品的销售许可。

[MEANING 4]vt.准许，授权使用: to permit or authorize especially by formal license
[EXAMPLE]A state statute licenses county sheriffs to choose their own deputies.法律允许郡上的司法长官选择自己的副手。 licensed to use deadly force获准使用致命火力

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 1]adj失去感觉的: devoid of sensation especially as a result of cold or anesthesia

[EXAMPLE]You can skip over the rhetorical passages and still get the gist of the essay. 你可以E兆过那些词藻华丽 的段落，直接获取文本的主旨。 The new governor delivered a long rhetorical speech about our state's bright future but laid out no specific programs for ensuring it.新的执政官发表了词藻华丽的演说，畅谈国家的美好未来，但却没有提出实现这一目标的具体措施。

meanings.explanation: [MEANING 1]n明喻: a figure of speech comparing two unlike things that is often introduced by like or as
meanings.example: [EXAMPLE]Even though both similes and metaphors are forms of comparison, similes indirectly compare the two ideas and allow them to remain distinct in spite of their similarities, whereas metaphors compare two things directly For instance, a simile that compares a person with a bullet would go as follows: "Chris was a record-setting runner as fast as a speeding bullet" A metaphor might read something like, "When Chris ran, he was a speeding bullet racing along the track" 尽管明喻和暗喻都是比喻的手法，明喻会间接地对两个对象进行比较，[SYNONYMS]时允许差异的 存在，而暗喻则直接对两者进行比较。比如说，用明喻来把一个人比作子弹会这样说: “克里斯是一个不断打破记 录的选手，他跑得就和高速子弹一样快。”而暗喻可能会说: “当克里斯奔跑的时候，他就是一颗在赛场上高速飞行 的子弹。”

desc:
[MEANING 1]n.明喻: a figure of speech comparing two unlike things that is often introduced by like or as
[EXAMPLE]Even though both similes and metaphors are forms of comparison, similes indirectly compare the two ideas and allow them to remain distinct in spite of their similarities, whereas metaphors compare two things directly. For instance, a simile that compares a person with a bullet would go as follows: "Chris was a record-setting runner as fast as a speeding bullet." A metaphor might read something like, "When Chris ran, he was a speeding bullet racing along the track." 尽管明喻和暗喻都是比喻的手法，明喻会间接地对两个对象进行比较，[SYNONYMS]时允许差异的 存在，而暗喻则直接对两者进行比较。比如说，用明喻来把一个人比作子弹会这样说: “克里斯是一个不断打破记 录的选手，他跑得就和高速子弹一样快。”而暗喻可能会说: “当克里斯奔跑的时候，他就是一颗在赛场上高速飞行 的子弹。”
